name: Dialogues with Books: Monthly Meetup
description: Join Bangalore`s Iconic Book Community - Monthly DWB Meetup! 📚Join Dialogues with Books (DWB) for our monthly gathering where fellow bibliophiles come together to celebrate the joy of reading!What We`ll Do -Come with a book you`ve been enjoying lately - any genre welcome! We`ll all share what we`re reading, why it resonates with us, and dive into lively discussions about the stories and ideas that captivate us. Feel free to read favourite passages aloud and discover your next great read through fellow bibliophiles` recommendations.Expect an evening of engaging book conversations over warm beverages, light snacks, and great company!About DWB - Dialogues with Books is one of Bangalore`s oldest book communities, creating a vibrant, inclusive space where literature lovers share their passion and form lasting friendships through books. Whether you`re a seasoned reader or looking to reconnect with reading, you`ll find a warm welcome here.DWB is Perfect For: Book enthusiasts, readers wanting to discover new genres, and anyone seeking thoughtful literary conversations in Bangalore`s vibrant reading community.Location: Dialogues KoramangalaMeet Your Host: Bharat - Bharat is an avid reader, writer, and passionate bibliophile with eclectic literary tastes spanning classics, fiction, philosophy, poetry, and self-improvement. His favorite authors include Hemingway, Murakami, Mishima, P.G. Wodehouse, and Edgar Allan Poe. His infectious enthusiasm for books and skill at facilitating discussions makes every meetup both stimulating and enjoyable.

location.address: 21, 80 Feet Rd, Nirguna Mandir Layout, 4th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Dialogues Cafe Private Limited
organizer.description: Dialogues Cafe is a warm, homely space in Koramangala where natural light meets community vibes. Enjoy freshly made, minimalist cuisine while engaging in open mics, book clubs, and more. Whether you’re here to work, create, or connect, Dialogues Cafe is your space to belong.

name: Brigade road heritage walk.
description: Join us as we revive our cherished walks through the historic Cantonment this year. Step back in time as we trace the origins of this storied district once the heart of colonial Bangalore.On this journey we will explore a magnificent church that has stood the test of time pay homage at a solemn war memorial and admire a beautifully restored heritage structure. Along the way we will encounter stately British-era government buildings a statue of a notable foreigner and a road steeped in its own fascinating history.Every corner of the Cantonment whispers tales of its past—stories of soldiers administrators and the many communities that shaped this unique enclave. Join us as we rediscover its enduring legacy one step at a time.

location.address: 15K, Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560025, India

organizer.name: Bengaluru by foot
organizer.description: Heritage, food & architectural walks in Bangalore.

name: Mahabharata Dialogues - Epic Stories
description: Embark on a captivating journey into the legendary stories of the Mahabharata. Join us for a series of live storytelling sessions that will transport you into the fascinating world of the greatest epic ever written. Immerse yourself in that world and discover the heroic deeds, complex relationships, and moral dilemmas that have enthralled audiences for centuries.Host : Abhilash Purohit is an entrepreneur and a corporate educator.These last few years, he is stuck between two states of existence: (Re)reading the Mahabharata, and talking about the characters in it - their interactions, their aspirations, and their dilemmas.To audiences small and big, he brings the joy of the stories and the lessons within the Mahabharata. He finds and shares different perspectives of well-known stories from the world`s greatest epic.When not talking Mahabharata, he loves to geek out about coding and Urdu shayari.

description: India's first and biggest craft chocolate festival celebrating homegrown chocolate makers, cacao farmers, and artisans who are uplifting the community together, joined by industry experts and international guests! Come and taste unlimited chocolate, meet the makers, celebrate with the community, and attend free workshops or sign up for what you like via our Instagram!

organizer.description: The Indian Cacao & Craft Chocolate Festival was born after 5 years of exploring farms and makers across India. We aim to unite them, celebrate India’s unique cacao, and raise awareness by connecting farms, makers, and consumers for the growth of Indian-origin chocolate.

name: Harry Potter Book Discussion
description: For hard-core Potterheads age 12 and above!Get into the minds of the characters, ferret out the intricacies of the plot - enter the wizarding world and share your thoughts and insights!Will help if you have read all the Harry Potter books - this discussion will be based only on the books and not the movies.The event is curated by Lahe Lahe Caravan and is being hosted at Atta Galatta.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Soumik Datta | Travellers
description: Soumik Datta | Travellers Award-winning sarod musician and composer Soumik Datta blends ambient soundscapes, spoken word, and Indian classical roots to create an experience that is both emotive and immersive. With the evocative voice of the sarod at its heart, Travellers is a sonic journey that layers field recordings and immersive sound design with live music that stretches time and pulses between memories, transporting audiences across the invisible borders that divide land, places, and people. This performance is part of Soumik’s Melodies in Slow Motion Tour, a seven-month journey across India that brings his music to concert halls, homes, heritage sites, juvenile centres, national borders, and schools, interacting with marginalised communities that often go unheard. This show is presented by Culturegrind.Credits: Sarod & Composition - Soumik Datta Violin - Sayee Rakshith Tabla - Debjit Patitundi Mridangam & Percussion - Sumesh Narayanan “Travellers” is co-produced by Soumik Datta Arts, G5A In Residence & Arts Council England.  Entry only on advance ticket booking.Seating on first come first serve basis.Gates open at 6.45 PM.NO PARKING at the venue. Parking only at Westside or Dickenson Road.

location.address: 262, Kamaraj Rd, Shivaji Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560042, India

name: Atta Galatta presents “Support Group”
description: Support Group by Nimesh George and Gokul R. People make up big cities but what makes up people’s lives, hopefully not loneliness. Loneliness is an intensely painful state which arises out of lack of intimacy and connectedness. People from every walk of life, even those with social contacts or pursuing successful careers can experience sadness from absence of belongingness. This painful experience is felt in a myriad of contexts such as breakups, disagreeing families, fear of rejection, unrelatability, shyness and so on.This support group has been constituted to bring people struggling with disconnectedness in various contexts together for a shared experience of comfort, belongingness, laughter, guidance and above all to break the cycle of sustained loneliness.The support is being organized and moderated by Nimesh George Mphil PhD who is a practicing psychologist based in Bangalore. This session will be co-moderated by Nimesh George & Gokul R, who are both practising psychologists in Bangalore.

name: Food In Literature Book Club
description: Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of foodliterature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, todifferent cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but toeach other as well.So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us for adialogue on “Food in Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month withPrachi Grover, we read our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.October Read: Desi Delicacies. Edited by Claire ChambersWe assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; acommunity for people who to love to read and eat!When: Saturday, 25th October, 2025 at 11 a.m.Where: Atta Galatta Bookstore, Indira NagarAges: 18+Registration is mandatory : https://t.ly/BO6wVCopies of the book are available at the store.

name: Eureka Eklavya Festival
description: Eureka Eklavya Festival - A celebration of curiosity, creativity, and childhood joy.Eklavya School invites children and families to the Eureka Eklavya Festival, a vibrant, day-long celebration designed especially for children aged 2 to 10 years. The festival is all about sparking curiosity, imagination, and the pure joy of learning through play. Grab this opportunity to interact with renowned artists and experts in their field, who will conduct a hands-on workshop for your child.See your child go from the theatre workshop to wooden blocks session, to Pottery, to petting unique animals to enjoying Rameshwaram Cafe to the Drum Circle, all between 10am-4pm! Every corner of the festival offers hands-on fun and discovery for young minds, you would need to choose from dozens of simultaneous sessions!What's more, enjoy the delicious food of Rameshwaram Cafe and 200 children will win prizes worth upto Rs. 2,000/- each from lunch box experts Basil and baked goodies from The Baker's Dozen!Limited spots are available.Entry pass is on a per child basis. Two adults may accompany the child free of cost.Entry pass includes access to all Free workshops and activities. Some workshops may be paid.What's happening at the festival?Prani Pet Sanctuary's interaction with AnimalsDrum CirclePottery & Clay work Storytelling & PuppetryTheatre workshopLearning music & musical instruments from a pianist & musicianNature walk exploring flora and fauna on the 1 acre campusEuropean Wooden Block PlayString GamesBlock PrintingPebble PaintingTattoo ArtistBig Bubble StationBook Fair by Dragonfly Reads Bookstore

name: Georgette Heyer Reader Meetup
description: “Georgette Heyer Reader Meetup”A Group discussion for Literature EnthusiastsSun, 26 Oct 2025, 11 AMGeorgette Heyer's blend of humor, clever dialogue, a brisk moving plot, historical accuracy and, of course, romance, is an absolute delight for all readers. You can escape into a world of leisure, populated by broad-shouldered noble lords and witty ladies who dreamt of love over a marriage of convenience ...Often set in Regency-era London, these novels revolved around the lives of the wealthy upper classes – society’s ton and their quirks.Whether you are a fan of many years or someone who is just starting out reading her novels you are more than welcome to join us to discuss and marinate in her world...

name: Atta Galatta presents “Let Poetry Be”
description: This monthly gathering will see poetry coming to life, through reading, music, art and any other forms of artistic expression, at Atta Galatta. Listeners and performers are all welcome!Date: 25th OctTime: 4pm Venue: Atta Galatta, IndiranagarEvent specifics & submission guidelines –1. Theme - Free Verse (any original work)2. Works can be original or of other poets, performed live3. All languages welcome4. Participants can read to music (acoustic instrument/s), dramatise, use props & costumes5. Each participant will enjoy 5 minutes of reading time6. Kindly submit your poem and name to letpoetrybe@gmail.com on or before 23rd Oct midnight. WE WILL NOT ACCEPT ATTACHMENTS OR LINKS. SUBJECT OF YOUR MAIL MUST READ AS 'Entry for -Oct LPB meet-up '7. You may also send entries that are not related to the theme8. The event will begin at 4pm sharp and will be held at Atta Galatta. Participants to report not later than 3:45 pm to hear about performance order and meet the host9. For any further clarifications, write to us at letpoetrybe@gmail.comYou are now welcome to flood our inbox!

name: ALT EFF 2025 <> Opening Weekend
description: In a world where the old stories of domination over nature no longer hold, we stand at a crossroads: regeneration or collapse. What will be (y)our legacy?The legacy we leave behind will be shaped by the strength of our community.Join us for the opening weekend of the All Living Things Environmental Film Festival’s 6th edition as we take over BIC in Bengaluru. It’s a weekend-long celebration packed with stellar cinema, immersive art experiences, workshops, filmmaker Q&A, and delicious food and drinks included in your ticket price! There is something for everyone, so bring your family, bring your friends and meet the kind of community you’ve been waiting for. See you there!

location.address: 7, 4th Main Rd, 2 Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

organizer.name: All Living Things Environmental Film Festival
organizer.description: All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF), the world’s largest decentralised film festival, is back for its 6th edition with groundbreaking cinema that reframes our gaze toward stories of renewal, resilience, and hope. 86 films from 39 countries, spanning genres, languages and styles.

name: A Halloween Special with Boo! Ya Watchin
description: As a lover of all things horror, if there’s a Boo! Ya Watchin? screening you shouldn’t miss, it’s a horror film. After hosting several Halloween special screenings, including a special premiere of Longlegs with PVR in Bangalore last year, she’s back with a cult classic this month, Rec (Spanish). The special evening includes the screening of this 73-minute nail-biter (with an unpredictable ending 👀) and will be followed by a special performance by DJ Rishi Sippy, with the perfect tunes to boogie the scares away. Expect a custom cocktail menu, pass around snacks and more. So show up in your best Halloween costume, enjoy a movie & end your Sunday evening with a dance party! Note: Gates open at 7pm and the screening will begin at 7:30pm. We request all our guests to arrive on time for us to begin the screening as planned. The dance party will start at 9:45pm post the screening and mixer.Boo! Ya Watchin?, the brainchild of Mahima. V is a Bangalore-based film screening series that turns cult classics and hidden gems into shared, immersive experiences.  REC (2007) is a Spanish found-footage horror film directed by Jaume Balagueró and Paco Plaza. The story follows TV reporter Ángela Vidal and her cameraman as they cover a routine night shift at a fire station—until a call to an apartment building turns their night into a nightmare. Shot in real-time with a claustrophobic, handheld style, REC delivers relentless tension and scares across its tight 75-minute runtime. While its intensity may not resonate with everyone, it’s widely regarded as one of the most terrifying found-footage horrors ever made.Rishi Sippy is a Bangalore-based DJ and is the brain behind beloved dance IPs in the city like Jackfruit Dance Party & Freak Opera. Rishi's performances are dynamic and immersive, fluid journeys that blend hypnotic minimalism with raw, driving energy. At Urbanaut, we're building unique and niche experiences in collaboration with our ever-present partners. Invite yourself to one — or three — or hit us up with ideas and collaborations!Ladies Who Loiter is a celebration inspired by leisure, love and art. Carefully curated by some incredible women, this is our little love letter to ladies everywhere to add more leisure, lightness, play and art into their lives.

location.address: 37th, Crescent Hotel, Crescent Rd, High Grounds, Gandhi Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Urbanaut Experiences

name: Mandala Magic Workshop
description: Slow down for a few mindful hours with us as we explore the meditative practice of mandala art. In this guided session, you’ll learn to draw your own intricate, balanced patterns — one line at a time — and experience the quiet focus that comes with this beautiful, rhythmic process.Each participant will create a set of small mandalas that can be transformed into charming bookmarks, gift tags, or luggage ties — tiny tokens of calm you can carry with you.The session will be led by Usha Murthy, who has been practicing and teaching this art form for nearly a decade. Usha has conducted Dottin Mandala workshops in the U.S., and her work beautifully bridges the ancient roots of this practice — from Australian Aboriginal dot art to the Buddhist and Indian traditions of circular mandalas symbolizing life and harmony. To get a glimpse of her work, find her on Instagram @dottinmandalas.Her teaching style is gentle, step-by-step, and highly visual — a truly sensory experience. The workshop will be conducted in English, with Hindi support if needed.No prior art experience is required — just bring your curiosity and a willingness to slow down. All materials will be provided.Join us for a peaceful morning of art, conversation, and mindfulness — right in the cozy corners of our bookstore café.

name: Unmask the Art: Cherial Mask Making Workshop
description: Celebrate Traditional Indian Craftmanship with Dr. Sai PrenathyImmerse yourself in the vibrant world of Cherial masks, renowned for intricate designs and storytelling. Join our workshop to explore the history, significance, and craftsmanship of these iconic masks.Cherial masks are a traditional Indian art form originating from Cheriyal village in Telangana's Warangal district. These vibrant masks are a modified version of Nakashi art and are known for their intricate designs and storytelling.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: RANIs of INDIA - Lores of the Queendom (Bangalore)
description: RANIs of INDIA is a collection of stories from various oral, folk, mythical and historical narratives collected based on numerous travel and research over the last few years on the lesser-known or completely forgotten women rulers of this wonderful country by Vikram Sridhar . Over one hour, through oral story-telling smattered with folk songs , we travel the country, going deeper into many stories of Indian queens from myths, history and present times, whose stories need to be told and heard.From North to South, East to West there have been women rulers, administrators, changemakers who have changed and touched history and our heritage strongly.About Vikram SridharVikram Sridhar is a Performance Storyteller, TEDx Speaker, Theatre Practitioner.and a Narrative based Facilitator combining his various interests and work over 20+ years in Theatre, Conservation and Social Work. He believes in the Desi way of Storytelling as a strong medium of conservation from nature to human relationships as his stories are rooted in Folklore, Heritage and Ecology inspired from various communities of the soil . He strongly believes `A Story a Day keeps the Doctor Away ` not an apple

description: Hi there,​We are elated to extend an invitation to you to join us as we discuss 'The Effects of Climate Change on Farming'. ​The Session includes Talks by an esteemed panel of Speakers. ​This will be followed by a networking break for you to connect and explore collaborations or simply converse with our Speakers and fellow attendees to explore areas of mutual interest. We look forward to seeing you there. ​For any further queries, contact - ​Aashi Agarwal, Head of Engagement, Planet Pact​Selva Ganapathy, Co-founder & Head of Community, Planet Pact​Stay tuned to our socials for further updates: LinkedIn | Instagram

name: Halloween Evening : Children’s edition
description: The hottest party in town is here ! 🎉🎃 PopClub presents Kids Only Halloween Party. The one-of-its-kind, exclusive Halloween event curated for children PopClub' - Children exclusive experience club brings an unforgettable evening designed specially for children aged 8–14 — an evening where children can dance, laugh, experience and celebrate their way in a safe, vibrant, Indoor and fully supervised environment.🧙‍♂️ Dress Code - Halloween themed costume🪩 DJ + Dance Floor – A high-energy DJ party with disco lights and music, giving kids a real party vibe — no adults allowed!🎤 Live Beatbox & Performances – Experience electrifying entertainment from young talent and live performers.🍕 Delicious Treats & Snacks – Fun, food made for children.📸 Unlimited fun  - Games, entertainment & more❤️ Our Commitment: PopClub ensures a safe, inclusive, and joyful experience for every child. Your cooperation and timely communication help make the event magical for all!Important note🚗 Drop-off & Pick-up: Must be done by a parent or authorised guardian with valid ID verification at the gate; please ensure timely pick-up after the event.⚠️ Safety & Conduct: Activities are staff-supervised; children must follow rules and act responsibly. Misconduct may lead to removal without refund.🍕 Food & Allergies: Food and refreshments will be provided; parents should inform organisers in advance of any allergies or dietary restrictions.

name: Hand Embroidery Workshop
description: About the WorkshopUnwind from your busy schedules and join me for an enchanting Hand Embroidery Workshop. Hand embroidery is more than just a craft – it’s an experience.Why attend?Learn a Mindful, Timeless SkillEmbroidery slows you down in the best way possible. It’s a meditative, hands-on way to unwind from busy schedules.Connect with Creativity & CommunityYou’ll meet others who share a love for handmade art and be inspired by the group's collective energy.Take Home Something You MadeAt the end of the session, you’ll have a small, hand-embroidered piece – a keepsake of your effort and creativity.Date: October 25, 2025, Saturday Time: 4 to 6 PMAge: 15+Fees: INR 1,200/- This workshop includes all the materials.Each participant gets a cotton tote bag to embroider, which they will take back home.

name: Kannada Jamming for Kannada Rajyotsava
description: 🎶 Aaroha the band Presents: Kannada Jamming for Kannada Rajyotsava 🎶  This Kannada Rajyotsava, let’s come together to celebrate the spirit, culture, and soulful music of Karnataka! 💛❤️ Join Aaroha the Band for a special Kannada Jamming Session – an evening dedicated to the melodies that define our land. From timeless classics to contemporary hits that echo across generations, Aaroha brings you a heartfelt musical journey in the language of our roots. ✨ Highlights of the Event: 🎵 Soulful Kannada songs and unplugged renditions 🎤 Sing-along moments with the audience Let’s celebrate Kannada Rajyotsava not just with words, but with the universal language of music. Come, sing, sway, and feel the pride of being a Kannadiga! 📅 Date: 2nd November  🕒 Time: 6pm to 7:30pm 📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Indiranagar  Let the beats of Karnataka’s heart resonate through every chord and every voice. Aaroha the Band invites you to be part of this musical tribute to Namma Kannada Nadu! 💛❤️

description: About PicnicJoin us under the canopy of our lush city oasis for a sun-soaked (fingers crossed!) afternoon filled with board games, wine, coffee, and irresistible picnic plates by Candice's Gourmet Sandwiches & desserts by I.Likey ice creams.Picnic Plates by Candice's Gourmet SandwichesLight EatsTortilla Chips & Salsa (V)Veg Nachos (V)Mains (Sandwiches on a Sourdough Baguette)Chicken Banh MiTofu Banh Mi (V)Philly CheesesteakMushroom Philly Cheesesteak (V)DessertsChurros (V)Chocolate Chilli CakeIce cream menu by I.LikeyAlmond AffairBelgian Chocolate NoirVegan Mixed berryHoney Vanilla delight_________And don’t forget—your furry friends are welcome to join the fun too!See you at the yard for a perfect day out with great food, great coffee, and even better company.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Bringing outside food into the yard area is not permitted.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

description: Performance Workshop by Ishaa Parthan﻿Does the thought of performing or being in the spotlight make your heart beat wildly – but you still want to give performing a go? If yes, join us in this student-led performance workshop. You'll get a chance to overcome your stage fears through a series of playful and introspective theatre exercises that will hopefully 'steady your beating heart'!

name: Tarot & Intuition
description: Step into an afternoon of soulful reflection and intuitive discovery with Anuradha Shukla — celebrated Tarot reader, life coach, and author of “The Intuitive Edge: A DIY Tarot Guide for Smarter Decisions in Love and Business.”In a world full of noise, this gathering offers a quiet, meaningful space to reconnect with your inner wisdom. Through the ancient art of tarot, Anuradha gently guides participants to explore their emotions, clarify decisions, and realign with life’s deeper flow.The session will feature:Personal Tarot Readings – short, insightful sessions offering clarity and directionReflections on Intuition – understanding how to listen to the voice withinGuided Conversations – linking tarot symbolism with everyday choicesEnergy & Awareness Exercises – simple ways to ground and center yourselfWhether you seek answers about love, career, or personal growth, this event invites you to pause, reflect, and trust your intuition. The experience is designed to help you leave lighter, calmer, and more attuned to your own path.Come with curiosity, stay with openness, and leave with a renewed sense of clarity.Join us at Atta Galatta on 2nd November for an afternoon where spirituality meets insight — and where the tarot becomes a mirror to your soul.

Judgement free!Hosted by Nupur (@nupur.nri) and the Zero1 Network (by Zerodha), this evening is all about discussing, ranting, sharing challenges, and finding your tribe in a warm, relaxed space.Expect:✨ Halloween fun✨ Dinner included✨ Meet folks from top startups, FAANG companies, and impactful leaders📝 Apply to Attend: Attendance is by application only to keep it high-quality.

name: Fireworks: October Storytelling Meetup
description: *October Meetup Alert* Theme: Fireworks💥 Emotions that explode. Memories that crackle. Moments that sparkle. What are the fireworks in your story? 💥We're lighting the fuse on October 26th, and you’re invited to set the stage ablaze at our next meetup for adults at the warm and welcoming Atta Galatta café!🗓️ Date: Saturday, October 26th📍 Venue: Atta Galatta, Bangalore🕐 Time: 1:00 PM – 2:00 PM🎙️ Theme: FIREWORKS📬 To Share Your Story: Write to us at📧 bangalorestorytellingsociety@gmail.com✨ Only 5 storytelling spots available – so send in your pitches pronto!Whether it's a night that ended in sparks, a Diwali that changed everything, or a love story that went off like a rocket – we want to hear your tale. Come for the stories, stay for the magic. You are most welcome to join us a s listeners too.Let’s set the afternoon alight, one story at a time. 🔥

name: Leadership in Action: Book Launch Celebrations
description: 📣 You're Invited: Book Launch CelebrationLeadership in Action: Inspiring Stories and Strategies for Growth 🗓️ Date: 26-Oct-25 | 📍 Venue: Atta Galatta – The Book Store | 🕒 Time: 5PM – 6PM---From IT industry to big conglomerates, from steel plants to startups—this book has sparked conversations across industries.Since its release, Leadership in Action has resonated deeply with professionals navigating real-world challenges. With over 500+ copies sold across Kindle and print editions, and a 4.9-star rating on Amazon from 17+ verified reviews, the response has been nothing short of phenomenal.---💬 What Readers Are Saying:“I saw myself in these stories.” “It’s not just a book—it’s a movement.” “Finally, leadership that feels real.”---🔥 What to Expect at the Launch:· Live storytelling from featured leaders· Interactive leadership prompts from the book· Sneak peek into Padma’s upcoming books· Networking with changemakers, mentors, and readers---🎯 Why You Should Be There:Whether you're a mid-career professional, a founder, an HR leader, or someone seeking authentic growth—this event is your chance to connect, reflect, and lead with purpose.Let’s celebrate the stories that move us—and the strategies that shape us.📘 Leadership in Action is more than a book. It’s a call to rise.

Nallathambi as they discuss the art of translation and storytelling across languages. The event will be held on 25 October 2025, from 6 to 7 PM at Atta Galatta, Indiranagar, Bengaluru.

name: Sober Sundowners: Sober Sanctuary
description: Imagine a quiet evening where you can simply breathe, slow down, and be surrounded by people who understand. No expectations, no judgment—just a gentle space to reflect, share, and listen.We’re excited to introduce Sober Sanctuary—a regular meetup for those on the sober journey, designed to be more intimate and intentional. While we’re committed to curating larger sober events that are lively and fun, Sober Sanctuary offers something different: a quieter space to connect with like-minded people, build community, and explore what life beyond alcohol can look like.Each session invites you to slow down, share experiences, and spend time in quiet reflection, while also exploring the small shifts in daily habits that can spark lasting change. You’ll be joined by Sarah, a certified habits and lifestyle coach, who will help guide the flow and hold space for meaningful conversations.*This isn’t a formal or structured rehab program, but rather a welcoming circle where you can listen, reflect, and grow alongside others. Whether you’re sober, sober curious, or simply looking for deeper, more intentional connections, you’ll find a supportive home here.

name: Land or Love? Book Reading of Battle of Lands
description: Join us for an engaging morning at Atta Galatta, Bengaluru’s beloved bookstore and cultural space, as Vandita Mishra discusses her latest book, Battle of Lands.Rooted in the complexities of Indian families, Battle of Lands explores how love, ego, and the pursuit of inheritance intertwine to leave scars that echo across generations. Through its layered narrative, the book reflects on relationships fractured by property disputes and the silent emotional wounds carried within families, asking readers to ponder what truly endures: land or love.The session will be followed by an audience interaction and book signing.Register using: https://in.bookmyshow.com/plays/land-or-love-book-discussion-battle-of-lands/ET00466807?webview=trueVenue: Atta Galatta, BengaluruDate and Time: November 1st, 11:30 AM- 1:00 PMEntry: Free

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: USIRU Breathing Workshop
description: A transformative 3-hour immersive Neuro-reboot workshop designed to help you recalibrate with your breath, reset dysregulated stress responses, and experience emotional regulation for performance optimisation.Many of us go through life breathing shallowly and unconsciously — leaving our nervous system in a constant state of stress. Usiru Breathwork guides you to re-train your nervous system using breath, scientific, somatic, and meditative tools so you can heal anxiety, calm your mind, and restore inner peace.Under the guidance of Raanika D. Kararia, an experienced breath master and healer, this session integrates breathwork, meditation, energy release, and guided healing techniques to support deep relaxation and enhance resilience and adaptability.

location.address: 1st Floor, Arka Anugraha Hospital, 2, 15th Cross Rd, KR Layout, 6th Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

name: Bebey’s Day Out: Book Discussion
description: Step into the richly woven world of Bebey’s Day Out by Lakshmi C.V, where stories moveseamlessly across centuries, cities, and states of mind. From the bustling IT hubs of modernIndia to the quiet cotton fields of the seventeenth-century Deccan, Lakshmi crafts tales thatexplore the fragile boundaries between the ordinary and the extraordinary, the real and thesupernatural. Each story opens a window into a different world — one filled with love, loss, guilt,and grace.Populated with a memorable cast — from a spirited old lady to a weary housewife and arestless teenager — this collection delves into the raw, unguarded emotions that make ushuman. Told with insight, warmth, and gentle humour, Bebey’s Day Out is a celebration of life’sunpredictability, reminding us that beneath every moment of chaos or calm lies a story waiting tobe told.About the authorLakshmi C.V. is a writer who delightfully blurs the lines between being a storyteller and ahomemaker — though she’s still deciding which came first. A Physics graduate from IIT with herhead often in the clouds but her feet firmly on the ground (also the name of her blog), Lakshmibrings warmth, humour, and heart to everything she writes. Her journey as a writer began early,with her first piece published in Eve’s Weekly while she was still in school.Her stories have since appeared in Femina, Woman’s Era, Good Housekeeping, Today,Women’s Web, and Readomania, among others. She has also written books for children andcontributed to anthologies like Airavata: Elephant Tales. When not lost in words, Lakshmi can befound teaching, volunteering, or reading — always finding joy in the journey rather than thedestination.She slips in and out of teaching mode without warning. It was quite a relief to her children whenshe took up assignments as a volunteer with Teach India.When she is not writing, she is reading for herself, and editing other people’s works.For her, the journey is more interesting than the destination.She lives in the NCR.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: Pint of View (Lecture 9): Hindi Cheeni Bhai Why?
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore’s first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.After space missions, visual thinking, and bats & birds, we’re now turning our gaze to geopolitics.For our next lecture, we bring you Manoj Kewalramani, one of India’s foremost China watchers, for an unmissable evening titled “Hindi Cheeni Bhai Why? – Handshake or Standoff? A New Chapter in India-China Ties” that navigates Indo-China relationships post Trump tarrifs and Operation Sindoor.Over the last five years, India and China have gone from border stand-offs to tentative handshakes. As both nations navigate a rapidly changing global order, are we witnessing a genuine reset—or just a strategic pause? Manoj will unpack the complexities behind Asia’s most consequential relationship and what it means for India’s future.All this, over a complimentary Geist beer or a mocktail at Jolly Johnny’s Bar in Koramangala.What to Expect:🐘 A 45-minute talk decoding the shifting dynamics of India–China relations🧭 20 minutes of open Q&A to challenge, debate, and discuss🍻 A 30-minute mixer to chat with fellow policy and pint enthusiasts🍺 One complimentary Geist beer or mocktail with your ticket🍕 À la carte menu available through the evening✨ Ideas, perspectives, and conversations that might just change how you see the neighbourhoodEvent Details:📅 Wednesday, 29th October | 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM📍 Jolly Johnny’s Bar, Koramangala🎫 Limited to 80 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for the first 10 ticketsAbout the Speaker:Manoj Kewalramani is Fellow – China Studies and Chairperson of the Indo-Pacific Studies Programme at the Takshashila Institution.He is the author of Smokeless War: China’s Quest for Geopolitical Dominance (Bloomsbury, 2021) and Taming the Dragon: A Manifesto for a New Modus Vivendi with China (Rupa, 2026).Manoj has testified as an expert witness before the US-China Economic and Security Review Commission in 2022 and 2024.About Pint of View:Pint of View is inspired by the “Lectures on Tap” movement in the U.S. — a place where big ideas meet bar tables.We’re bringing that format to India: one evening, one speaker, one drink, and a whole new way of looking at the world.Book now and develop your own Pint of View. 🍻

location.address: 897/b NGV main road, 80 Feet Rd, National Games Village Complex, 6th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: Pint of View, Bengaluru
organizer.description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where cutting-edge science meets craft beer. Inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap movement in the US, Pint of View is bringing this revolutionary format to India for the very first time.

name: Fruit Mixing
description: As the festive season draws near, the air at Studio M fills with the scent of spices, candied fruit, and cheer — it’s time for our annual Fruit Mixing Ceremony!A Tradition Rooted in CelebrationThe story of the Christmas cake dates back to 17th-century England, when rich plum puddings were prepared to mark the end of the Advent fast. Over time, these evolved into the fruit-laden Christmas cakes we know and love today — dense with soaked fruits, spices, and warmth. Every bite tells a story of tradition, family, and festive indulgence.The Significance of Fruit MixingFruit mixing marks the beginning of the Christmas baking season. It’s a joyful ritual where dry fruits, nuts, and peels are blended with aromatic spices and generous splashes of spirits or wine — then left to mature and soak in all that festive goodness. The longer the mix rests, the richer the flavor — just like how good things in life deepen with time.At Studio M, this ceremony is more than just preparation — it’s our way of ushering in the spirit of togetherness. It’s laughter shared over sticky spoons, the sparkle of wine poured into jars, and the joyful anticipation of cakes that will soon fill our ovens (and hearts) with warmth.A Toast to Christmas TraditionsFrom lighting candles to caroling, gifting, and baking, every Christmas ritual reminds us to slow down and celebrate the beauty of giving. Our fruit mixing day carries that same essence — a sweet start to a season filled with gratitude, love, and community.So come join us as we stir, laugh, and soak — and raise a toast to the season of joy!

name: Lobster Meets- Pizza Edition-Bengaluru
description: Our pizza-making workshop, exclusively designed for verified* singles!Learn the art of kneading, topping, and baking your perfect pizza from scratch.It’s not just about food—it’s about fun conversations and genuine connections.Cook, laugh, and share your delicious pizza with like-minded people.A perfect mix of culinary delight and social bonding, all in one day!For all the fans of the popular sitcom FRIENDS, you probably get why the name Lobster Meets.For all those looking for their lobster, new friends or just to meet new people, Lobster Meets is the place to be.Lobster Meets by Lobster Search is a socialising event for verified* singles.Our aim is to facilitate interaction among as many singles as possible in a warm, fun and lively environment.While we take no guarantees of Cupid striking, we suggest you come with an open mind, as you may find a friend,a person with similar interests or potentially your forever person!We take pride in maintaining over an 80% gender ratio at all our events.See you at the event.Looking forward to hosting you!_____________________________________Please note -1. Post purchasing this ticket, you will receive a verification call from us.2. Your participation is confirmed post the verification call.3. If for some reason, we cannot host you, we shall refund the money, barring points 4 and 5.4. Please be aware that this event is only meant for heterosexual people who are single, never married or legally single. 5. If you are married or undergoing separation, you should not purchase this ticket. If purchased by people who are married or undergoing separation/divorce, there would be no refund.6. The organiser reserves the right to ask any guest to leave the event at any time if their behaviour is deemed inappropriate, disruptive, or in violation of event guidelines. This is to ensure a safe and comfortable experience for all attendees.

name: Eat Better - Better Breakfasts
description: Eat Better is part MyBoTree’s ongoing series on eating clean and seasonally — designed to make cooking approachable, mindful, and easy to understand. This edition celebrates the importance of a wholesome breakfast, exploring how the first meal of the day can set the tone for better energy, focus, and overall well-being. 🍳 Led by Chef Sunayana Pradhan (Ex-Sous Chef, New Zealand & France), the session will dive into creative, unconventional approaches to morning meals that are both nourishing and exciting. Because a good breakfast, made with intention, is the simplest way to eat — and live — better. ✨Best part: Tasting portions for all!

organizer.name: MyBoTree
organizer.description: MyBoTree, founded by three women, is a vibrant hub for purpose-driven programs focused on joyful, transformative experiences that empower communities and individuals to grow and connect. They actively partner with social enterprises and non-profits.

name: Pint of View(Lecture 10): Much Ado About 'Moth'ing
description: Welcome to Pint of View – Bangalore's first-ever community where lectures meet drinks in a relaxed pub-style setting.Did you know some moths can disguise themselves as leaves or bark to avoid predators? They navigate by moonlight, often confused by our streetlights, and males can detect a female’s scent from over ten kilometers away. Moths are also vital night-time pollinators—and some, like the Luna Moth, don’t eat at all, living just long enough to find love before fading away.For our 10th lecture, we’re thrilled to host Dr. Pritha Dey, Moth Biologist and Evolutionary Ecologist, and Head of Natural History Collections at NCBS Bangalore.In “Much Ado About ‘Moth’ing”, Dr. Dey shines a light on one of nature’s most overlooked wonders — moths. Often dismissed as mere “night butterflies,” moths are among the most diverse and ecologically vital insect groups. Through stories from her fieldwork in the Western Himalayas and Western Ghats, Dr. Dey will reveal their hidden beauty, crucial ecological roles, and how you can start spotting and identifying them right from your own backyard.From setting up simple light traps to photographing and recording species, this session will help you discover the rich nocturnal biodiversity just outside your door and maybe even change the way you look at porch lights forever.All this, over a complimentary Geist beer or mocktail at the charming Jamming Goat 3.0 in Indiranagar.What to Expect:🦋 A 45-minute session blending science, stories, and hands-on moth-watching insights🧠 15–20 minutes of Q&A to ask your questions and share your own nature observations🍹 A 30-minute mixer to chat, connect, and exchange stories with fellow attendees🍺 One complimentary beer or mocktail included with your ticket🍕 À la carte food menu available throughout the evening✨ Science, stories, and conversations that might just light up your nightEvent Details:📅 Sunday, 26th October | 4:00 PM – 6:00 PM📍 Jamming Goat 3.0, Indiranagar, Bangalore🎫 Limited to 90 attendees only💰 Early bird pricing available for first 10 ticketsAbout the Lecturer:Dr. Pritha Dey is the Head of Natural History Collections at the National Centre for Biological Sciences (NCBS), Bangalore. Her research spans the taxonomy, diversity, and evolutionary ecology of moths, shaped by fieldwork in the Western Himalayas and Western Ghats. Beyond research, she is deeply involved in science communication and serves as the Country Coordinator for National Moth Week in India.About Pint of View:Pint of View is inspired by the successful Lectures on Tap community in the U.S. We’re bringing this format to India — where big ideas meet bar tables, and where you enjoy a drink in hand while walking out with a new way of seeing the world.Book now & develop your own pint of view! 🍻

name: Flash Jam: Sing and Jam with Strangers
description: We’re a one-day choir of amateur singers that get together, sing and harmonise and jam our hearts out! That's right, experience or skill level is no bar - if you want to learn about vocal harmony, or just have fun and sing in a community, this is the place for you! This time, we’ll be performing Chiquitita, by ABBA! So come join us for a fresh, memorable weekend session :)

name: Coffee and Conversations
description: What about some Filter Coffee and Unfiltered conversations on a fine Sunday morning?Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment.We at Listeners Circle are committed to building a community where there are no unsaid words, held back emotions and buried feelings because of the fear of being judged.After 50+ Editions of Tell your Story, Listeners Circle relaunching a lighter format - Coffee and Conversations!Coffee lightens us up. Coffee gives us clarity. Coffee refreshes up. Sip a coffee and speak your heart out without fear of judgment and listen without judging! Coffee is on us and the onus of conversation without judgment is on you.Every word matters. Every emotion matters. Every feeling matters.Think about how it would feel to take an hour out of your fast-paced life and share your experiences and thoughts to people who listen to you without judging over a cup of Coffee? Also, listen to others without judging.Listeners` circle Coffee and Conversations -This is an event to make that happen.Be a part of the Listener`s circle Coffee & Conversations - Edition 5.Speak your mind without being judged. Speak your mind without any boundaries. No photography and videography without consent. Your stories stay within the four walls of the room and the hearts.Would you like to just listen? We have a place for you too.Book your passes in advance to avoid the last-minute sell outs.Listeners Circle is an initiative to facilitate listening without judgment, hence giving a safe space for anyone to speak their heart out without the fear of judgment. We have done 50+ sessions over the last year, enabling people to voice their stories. Coffee & Conversations is our new format based on popular demand.

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India

name: An Evening of Survivor & Protest Poetry
description: An Evening of Survivor & Protest Poetry, Feminism, and HealingUnder the Jackfruit Tree is not just a book — it is a reclamation. An evening that bridges poetry and protest, music and memory, trauma and tenderness. Join Nish, poet and author of Under the Jackfruit Tree, for a one-hour immersive experience that intertwines survivor poetry, trauma stories, feminist reflections from the 90s, and a heartfelt journey of inner child healing.This evening celebrates the voices that survived, the children who grew up too soon, and the communities that continue to rebuild themselves with love, dissent, and resilience.Expect raw spoken word because healing, after all, is incomplete without unconditional love.About the BookUnder the Jackfruit Tree: A Tribute to the Inner Child and a Chorale of Hopeis an unflinching collection of poems that unearth the layered histories of trauma, inheritance, and healing.Nish writes with a voice that is both political and personal — a lyrical rebellion that meditates on the legacies of survival, feminism, and compassion.Through six acts of poetry, the book journeys from childhood rupture to adult repair, culminating in an anthem of hope and defiance — a manifesto for those who have ever longed for gentleness in a brutal world.About the AuthorNish is a Survivor and proud Thriver, a poet and community builder devoted to trauma healing, inner child work, and feminist storytelling.She is also a tech product leader by profession, living in Bengaluru with her partner of 15 years and two beloved Indies.Writing under her poetic identity Gargle in Grey, Nish believes in the power of a conscious community and the refusal of binaries — in life, love, and art.This launch isn’t merely a literary event — it’s a social movement through verse.Each reading becomes a protest, each poem a reclamation of language and tenderness from the jaws of trauma.“Through my poems,” Nish says, “I speak to the ones who have survived in silence. This book is an ode to them — and to the children we once were, who kept us alive.”

location.address: 178, 5th Main Rd, Indira Nagar 1st Stage, 1st Stage, Indiranagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560038, India
